channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Customers lament Tesla’s move toward monthly fees for self-driving cars: ‘You will own nothing and be happy’
item.description: Elon Musk announced Tesla would no longer allow outright purchases of self-driving software, and users aren't happy.

item.title: Why The Most Viral Creators Are Making Their Content Worse
item.description: As AI automates perfect content creation, top creators are intentionally lowering production quality. Raw, imperfect content is the new authenticity s...

item.title: ‘They’re going to have to think and act a lot more like hotels’: The new rules of office space now that the ‘genie is out of the bottle on hybrid’
item.description: From cold plunges to nap pods to meditation rooms, many employers are turning to luxury to lure in their workers.

item.title: 45 sickened with salmonella in connection with recall of Super Greens diet supplement powder
item.description: At least 45 people in more than 20 states have been infected with salmonella food poisoning linked to the Super Greens brand of diet supplement powder...

item.title: Exclusive: Former OpenAI policy chief creates nonprofit institute, calls for independent safety audits of frontier AI models
item.description: Former OpenAI policy head Miles Brundage debuts AVERI, an institute advocating for independent safety audits of top AI models

item.title: Cerebras AI Lands A Whale As It Prepares To Go Public
item.description: OpenAI Needs to up its game as Google ramps up Gemini3 models and new TPUs. They may have found the answer in Cerebras.

item.title: From Text To Tables: Why Structured Data Is AI’s Next $600B Frontier
item.description: Tabular foundation models are the next major unlock for AI adoption, especially in industries sitting on massive databases of structured, siloed, and ...

item.title: Worried about AI taking your job? New Anthropic research shows it’s not that simple
item.description: Anthropic’s latest data suggests AI won’t wipe out work overnight—but it will redraw the map of who wins, who struggles, and how jobs actually change.

item.title: Oracle struggles to attract workers to Nashville ‘world HQ’—even with a 2-million-square-foot office and Larry Ellison’s favorite restaurant
item.description: Years after cofounder Larry Ellison declared Nashville its world headquarters, Oracle has added only a handful of workers.

item.title: iPhone 17e Release Date Just Weeks Away But 1 Feature May Disappoint, Report Says
item.description: Apple’s next smartphone is almost here. But it looks like an upgrade many were hoping for won’t materialize.

item.title: Hopping Mad Over Drug Company Product Hopping
item.description: Pharmaceutical patent protection can be extended when drug companies bring newer products to market before their first patent expires

item.description: President Trump's proposed 10% credit card interest rate cap could eliminate access for 175 million to 190 million cardholders, with lower and middle ...

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
